DEB Stylized Fact: With growth and development curves, it is possible to predict food intake and energy allocation, which is confirmed experimentally.
The relationship between length and body mass is predictable and depends on the shape coefficient.
Organisms can be described by the same set of DEB parameters throughout their entire life cycle, without needing to change the model in different phases.
Respiratory quotient (RQ) is predictable from the chemical composition of reserves and structure.
Nitrogen waste correlates with structure catabolism, not reserves.
Lipid content of the body correlates with reserves, and protein with structure.
Condition factor (CF) reflects the state of reserves relative to structure.
Gonadosomatic index (GSI) follows predictable seasonal cycles in mature individuals.
Hepatosomatic index (HSI) correlates with energy state and food availability.
Experimental starvation shows the hierarchy of metabolic priorities.
